alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 4:17AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Garfield and southwestern Wayne Counties through 500 AM MDT... At 415 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 9 miles northeast of Bryce Canyon National Park, or 27 miles west of Escalante, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Boulder, Bryce Canyon National Park, Tropic and Rubys Inn. This includes Utah Route 12 between mile markers 14 and 22, and between mile markers 84 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
